description: Kheer is a creamy and aromatic Indian rice pudding made with rice, milk, sugar, and flavored with cardamom, saffron, and nuts. It's a popular dessert served during festivals and special occasions.

ingredients.name: Saffron strands
ingredients.qty: A pinch, soaked in warm milk

steps: Wash the basmati rice thoroughly and soak it in water for about 30 minutes.
In a heavy-bottomed pan, heat ghee over medium heat. Add the soaked rice and saut√© for a couple of minutes.

Add milk to the pan and bring it to a gentle boil. Reduce the heat to low and let the rice cook in the milk, stirring occasionally, until it becomes thick and creamy. This may take about 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Once the rice is cooked and the kheer has thickened, add sugar, cardamom powder, saffron-soaked milk, chopped nuts, and raisins to the pan. Mix well and cook for another 5-10 minutes.
Remove the kheer from heat and let it cool to room temperature. It will thicken further as it cools.
Serve the kheer chilled or at room temperature, garnished with more chopped nuts and saffron strands if desired.
Enjoy the creamy and flavorful goodness of homemade kheer!
